page.title: 04PAPER MILL
page.content: The Guardbridge Paper Mill was established in 1872 and had a capital of Â£30,000. Building of the mill was finished in August of the next year. Today the Paper Mill has a capital of over Â£840,000 and has 360 workers. The Paper Mill delivers worldwide and gets its raw materials from various countries. The paper today is made from wood fibre, esparto grass and cotton. Pulp bales are added to thousands of gallons of water. The mixture passes to a machine which binds the fibres together then dries it by squeezing the water from the paper. It is then passed over suction boxes then steam heated in a cylinder. The paper is then cut, packaged and distributed by a sister company called Scotflow which has 10 lorries for the Papermill.
